name: European Transport Safety Council
goal:
ETSC is the sole European NGO dedicated to improving the safety of all transport modes. It provides an impartial source of research-based advice on transport safety matters to the European Commission, the European Parliament, and to national governments and organisations concerned with transport safety throughout Europe. It seeks to identify, evaluate and promote effective measures on the basis of international research findings, good evidence and best practice, in areas which offer the greatest potential for a reduction in transport crashes and casualties. The positions of ETSC, its contribution to the international community of safety experts and its research-based policy-advice for European policy-makers are generated by the work of more than 200 experts.

ETSC has established working parties of internationally renowned experts from across EU Member States in the areas of Road User Behaviour, Road Infrastructure, Road Vehicle Safety, Transport Accident Statistics, Air Safety, Rail Safety, Maritime and Inland Waterway Safety, Transport Safety Policy, Traffic Regulation Enforcement, Safety of Pedestrians and Cyclists, Telematics and Road Safety, Post Impact Care, Road Transport and Driving Fatigue, Transport Accident Investigation, Transport Safety Performance Indicators, Transport Safety Organisation, Risk Assessment and Target Setting, Evaluation of National Road Safety Policies, Road Safety Data.

ETSC regularly publishes international state of the art reviews on key aspects of transport safety based on independent professional consensus across the EU as well as a range of newsletters (the “Safety Monitor”, the “Speed Monitor”, the “Drink Driving” Monitor), developed a range of special editions of “ETSC Update” in key areas of transport safety and produced “Vision, Targets and Strategies” on targeted road safety policies in Europe.

ETSC has well established links with a variety of European and national organisations and authorities with interests and responsibilities in the field of transport safety.
interests: Business and Industry, Education and training, Public Health, Research and innovation, Transport
euInitiatives: Transport safety (General Safety Regulation, Infrastructure Safety Directive, Autonomous Driving, Road Safety Action Programme)
